column4: I was trying to stop my tty's being displayed at too low a resolution, and now no tty's seem to be started.
Is it possible to start a tty which I could switch to with ctrl + alt + fX ... from gnome-terminal ?
Ah correction, looking at ps aux ... I do have getty creating tty's now ... i just can't switch to them.
Is there a way to switch to a tty other than with ctrl + alt + fX?
In fact... where are ctrl + alt + Fx set up as shortcuts in the first place? Is that an X11 setting somewhere?
pretty sure the kernel does that
